title: Power Triangle Visualization
description: Interactive power triangle for learning power, voltage, current, and resistance relationships using P=VI and Ohm's Law. Students can click on variables to reveal formulas and use the built-in calculator.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Electrical Engineering
Circuit Analysis
Physics
learningObjectives: Use the power triangle to identify which formula to use for calculating power, voltage, or current
Apply the power equations P=VI, P=I²R, and P=V²/R to solve circuit problems
Explain the relationship between power, voltage, current, and resistance
prerequisites: Understanding of voltage and current concepts

controls.name: Triangle Variables
controls.description: Click P, V, or I in the triangle to cover that variable and reveal the formula

controls.name: Clear
controls.description: Clear all input values and results

limitations: Does not account for reactive power in AC circuits
